Be sure to imagine a turkey with fingers at the tip of its wings, counting from one to ten.

kanji.constituent: mountain

Since a mountain often brings to mind towering peaks, I will consider it implied that the element is placed at the top of the kanji. When this primitive appears at the bottom, I will arrange my story in a way that other elements are said to be at the very top of the mountain (see FRAME 775 for an example).

The three kanjis 碕, 埼 and 崎 all have the same meanings and pronunciations. They have very little uses other than names, for which promontory is the clear winner with over 2300 uses in place and people names, while the other two kanjis account for less than 200 names.

kanji.constituent: fabricate, bamboo, barge, craft, mediocre, wind, drop, tree, wood

kanji.constituent: person
kanji.story: Behold Mister T (of "A-Team" fame)! I chose Mr.T because he´s sure to make amusing stories. He is a very versatile character since he´s both the big, tough guy and the “moralistic” person, telling kids not “to do drugs or alcohol”. He is easy to imagine, the heavy gold chains are probably the most prominent feature of the character. And last but not least you can always pepper your story with the famous line “I pity da foo!” * Fittingly, on the left side of the kanji, it looks like a “T”.

kanji.constituent: assistant, person, left, by one’s side, craft
kanji.story: Mr T´s assistant is on his left. Why? Because Mr T has this bad habit of suddenly extending his right arm (what with all the boxing that he did), and his assistant got inadvertently punched in the face more than once (ouch). So now his assistant is always to his left side, much safer - "Stay on my left, foo!".

kanji.constituent: however, person, nightbreak, sun, day, one, floor
kanji.story: However drunk Mr T is when he comes back to his place, he always get up at nightbreak. “I pity da foo who gets up after nightbreak !”, says Mr. T.

kanji.constituent: dwell, person, candlestick, lord, drop, king, jewel, ball
kanji.story: When Mr T shows people round his dwelling he takes a big candlestick (with a candle in it!) so that the light shows off his collection of bling bling jewellery.

kanji.constituent: rank, person, vase, stand up
kanji.story: Mr T ranks first position in the stand-up competition (doing knee flexions). Just picture him doing hundreds of these while the rest of the participants are already completely exhausted after a mere hundred.

kanji.constituent: go-between, person, in, stick, mouth
kanji.story: When negotiating a hostage situation, Mr. T acted as the go-between, or person in the middle, for law enforcement and the terrorist.

kanji.constituent: body, person, origin, book, tree, wood, one
kanji.story: Mister T works out his body (body-building), using two piles of books (i.e. an exercise that can be done at home with two chairs, similar to push-ups but working mostly the shoulders, trapezius and triceps).

kanji.constituent: permanence, remote, person, stick, fred astaire, taskmaster, heart

kanji.constituent: affair, person, cow
kanji.story: Note: this kanji refers to event or case. Current Affair headline: Mr. T has affair with cow. "It´s only animal ´man´ enough for me".

kanji.constituent: attend, person, samurai

kanji.constituent: adhere, person, glue

kanji.constituent: substitute, person, arrow
kanji.story: Mister T substitutes an arrow for a toothpick -- The keyword meaning is to replace something with something else, to act for another, to represent. It´s best to stick to the first meaning, because the last two are very close to "mediator" which will come in frame 1761. The idea here is that the arrow is not a toothpick, neither it is changed into one, but it can substitute for one.

Note: as a primitive, it can help to use the image of "spare change", this can help you keep it distinct from other similar kanji such as "shape" or "turn into".

kanji.constituent: dissolve, tripod, one, ceiling, mouth, hood, human legs, street, nail, spike, insect
kanji.story: I have created the element "old camera" out of the left side of the kanji: from the subject´s point of view, the light is captured by one mouth (the lens). The photographer is under a big hood, we only see his legs, and he is holding a spike in his right hand, which is the shutter release. Now, at the time the photographer takes the photo, a little insect is flying near the flash. The flash is so powerful that the insect is burnt and dissolves in the air.

Picture a world map where all countries have their soil with one color, their national flag as the legend and a fence on the borders... don´t you think it looks like a giant puzzle?

kanji.constituent: hearth-fire, door, one, ceiling, flag

kanji.constituent: disclose, bouncer, door, one, ceiling, flag, taskmaster, mouth

kanji.constituent: show, altar, show, two, small

kanji.constituent: celebrate, altar, elder brother, teenager, mouth, human legs

kanji.constituent: blessing, altar, wealth, one, ceiling, mouth, rice field, brains

Basically, one gave wealth to the altar (i.e. priest) and received a blessing. If you prefer a Jewish version, think of the donation (wealth) that is expected when you´re called to the ark (altar in the kanji) to give a blessing over the torah.

kanji.constituent: welfare, altar, stop, footprint

kanji.constituent: company, altar, soil, dirt, ground

kanji.constituent: inspection, altar, see, telescope, eye, human legs

kanji.constituent: nara, large, St. Bernard, altar, show, two, small

kanji.constituent: military officer, flag, altar, show, two, small, glue

kanji.constituent: consolation, military officer, flag, altar, show, two, small, glue, heart

kanji.constituent: goodwill, samurai, altar, show, two, small, lack, yawn

kanji.constituent: prohibition, grove, tree, wood, altar, show, two, small, tree2, wood2
kanji.story: Similar to radical tyro´s story. If you live in Japan, your main exposure to this kanji is probably "no smoking" signs. So I imagine the government enacting a prohibition of tobacco, and burning whole groves of tobacco plants on an altar (the altar of public health, or self-righteousness, if you will).

kanji.constituent: collar, cloak, prohibition, grove, tree, wood, altar, show, two, small, tree2, wood2
kanji.story: A collar is the part of your cloak that, if tightened too tight, will prohibit breathing.

kanji.constituent: religion, house, altar, show, two, small

kanji.constituent: armour, armor, roots

The bit that pokes down is to protect the genitals, I guess.

They posted conquistadors at either side of the altars at the local missions, and if anybody refused to pray, they would get the axe.

kanji.constituent: near, axe, road

If they´re not done in 60 seconds, a huge axe descends from the ceiling and chops their work in half. Contestants know to recoil their hands from the falling axe, but some have been so absorbed in folding, they ignore the buzzer and get their fingers chopped off.

To this day, people in Hiroshima still fold origami cranes in her memory. For this character, let us imagine a parade in her honor, the entire road lined with folded cranes.

kanji.constituent: vow, fold, finger, fingers, axe, say, words, keitai, mouth

To everybody else it is an origami, but to them it is also a symbol of their vows. -- "the folded words are vows". Note : in this story and a few others I use the image of an origami for the primitive "fold".

kanji.constituent: temporarily, executioner, chop off, car, axe, sun, day

I take it as a pictograph or treasure map. Two dots represent big trees and the cross (marking the treasure) is placed relative to them.

(Raichu,11-7-2006) The way I remember it´s 昔 once upon a time (#1184) rather than 旧 olden times (#35) is that they began to use cutlery to eat salad. (I also think about how when you visit the Medieval Times theme park, which is set in Once upon a time, their gimmick is that you eat with your fingers.).

kanji.constituent: seat, caverns, cave, twenty, towel

So aroused here refers to being aroused because of anger over some unjust or wrong act, unfairness etc. It doesn´t seem to carry a meaning associated with arousal in the sense of sex or pleasure. So, my story: think of the angry state of mind aroused at finding all your clams buried under your haystack stolen, gone!

kanji.constituent: thread, spiderman

However, in the cases where this primitive appears under other primitives, as opposed to on the left (I think there are ~5 times in this chapter) I´ve opted to use a similar character: Venom. This helps keep the positioning clear, especially on such characters as dainty (#1363) and accumulate (#1364).

kanji.constituent: weave, thread, spiderman, kazoo, sound, vase, stand up, sun, day, fiesta

kanji.constituent: vertical, thread, spiderman, accompany, Nelson, column, going, line, horns, mend

kanji.constituent: practice, thread, spiderman, east, tree, wood, sun, day

kanji.constituent: tie, thread, spiderman, aerosol, samurai, mouth

Now, at US weddings, it ends with the couple driving away with cans being dragged behind the car. So here, think of SPIDERMAN, who will TIE the knot with Mary Jane. At his wedding, Spider THREAD attached (or TIED) to SPRAYCANS are being drug behind the limo as they drive off.

kanji.constituent: end, thread, spiderman, winter, walking legs, ice, drop, drop2

kanji.constituent: class, thread, spiderman, reach out, outstretched hands

In desperation he REACHES OUT to grab his friend´s answer sheet next to him, who seems to be doing well. The other test takers are obviously a class above him. Looks like this test is above his class of knowledge.

Spiderman finally caved in and decided to keep the little pig under one condition: the pig was to take a broom and sweep up all of Spiderman´s leftover threads after having fought crime. The pig felt such affinity for Spiderman, he happily accepted—and did a good job too.

(Note that the right half here is not "eels". This is (in my opinion) a mistake in the RTK book, as we already decided in waterfall (#537) to refer to the simplified form of dragon as "eels". It is much better to call the right half of this character an "unbound tortoise".).

You do the math in your head and it comes out to two cocoons per person. This is why the horizontal line is a fraction bar with two cocoons on the top, and one person the bottom.

It appears in several kanji, such as 縫 sew (#1563), 逢 tryst (#2417), 蜂 bee (#2687), and 鋒 sword´s point (#2768), and it is clumsy to work bushes and walking legs into every story. "Pointy" works fairly well: the walking legs are stuck on top of the pointy part of the bush; and for this character: a summit is the pointy end of a mountain.

Note: Heisig's warning to keep this distinct from other similiar kanji such as companion (#19), friend (#704), consort (#1203) and comrade (#1637). That is why I chose to have the person element pictured as someone (the colleague in this case) helping with the work of building the pup tent.

Then, a bar separating this frame from the next frame (remember that Japanese manga run the other way!), in which we see the insect covered with thread, making a beautiful cocoon.

kanji.constituent: benefit, animal horns, one, floor, animal legs, eight, dish
kanji.story: The benefit of having sharp horns and fast legs is that an animal can get to the food dish first.

kanji.constituent: spare time, sun, day, hobby, staples, mouth, box, crotch, box2
kanji.story: Some jackass-like people have way too much spare time. You can find video´s of them all over the internet, if you like such things, you can watch it all day. You see them stapling their mouths shut, or throwing eachother upside down in boxes or kicking each other in the crotch.

kanji.constituent: spread, arrowhead, rice field, brains, compass, direction, taskmaster
kanji.story: Instead of being glued to one specialty (#46) 専, I decided to spread my attention in many directions 方, and be a taskmaster at none.

kanji.constituent: come, not yet, animal horns
kanji.story: You horny bastard, don´t come, at least not yet!
kanji.kun_yomi: く.る、きた.る、きた.す、き.たす、き.たる、き、こ

kanji.constituent: spirit, landed fish, reclining, lying down, one, floor, fishhook, sheaf
kanji.story: You´re reclining on the floor trying to hook a sheaf with a small hook through the cracks. That you´ve been doing this for seven hours without success shows your burning spirit.

kanji.constituent: vapor, water, water droplets, water pistol, landed fish, reclining, lying down, one, floor, fishhook
kanji.story: Water vapor almost looks like a spirit but has no soul.

kanji.constituent: fly, hook, propeller, measuring box, thousand, needles, propeller2
kanji.story: Hooks with small wings attached look like hummingbirds with a long beak. Two hummingbirds are trying to fly away with our little measuring box. What do they want it for?

kanji.constituent: sink, water, water droplets, water pistol, garter, crown, human legs
kanji.story: (thx geezer) The maimed waitress (no head and arms just her legs and trunk) is dropped into the water with a cement crown to make sure she sinks. She shouldn´t have been so nosy about her yakuza-boyfriend´s schemes.

kanji.constituent: wife, ten, needle, rake, woman
kanji.story: Ten rakes woman. your wife digs her fingernails into you and it feels like 10 rakes when she finds you ontop of another woman.

kanji.constituent: decline, pathetic, stick, top hat, scarf, mouth
kanji.story: If you thought that the dude in 哀 was pathetic, you haven´t seen him after his decline. Here he is carrying a stick around in his mouth like a dog, begging people to throw it for him. Note that the mouth is closed only after the stick goes in, as is only logical.

kanji.constituent: inmost, ten, needle, mouth, scarf
kanji.story: The guy from pathetic (#401) shared his inmost feelings with a girl and she rammed a walking stick down his throat. It ruptured his inmost organs.

kanji.constituent: mask, hundred, one, ceiling, drop, pent in, eye
kanji.story: If you´re wearing a mask, a hundred eyes can look at you but none of them will know who you are.

kanji.constituent: leather, flowers, car, mouth, ten, needle
kanji.story: I asked the street vendor the price of the LEATHER jacket. He said TWENTY, but with my MOUTH, I talked him down to TEN. (correct stroke order).

kanji.constituent: shoes, leather, flowers, car, mouth, ten, needle, change, person, spoon, sitting on the ground
kanji.story: Leather shoes are nice because they change shape to fit your foot.

kanji.constituent: hegemony, old west, leather, flowers, car, mouth, ten, needle, moon, month, flesh, part of the body
kanji.story: In the old west, animal skins were made into leather and their flesh was eaten, thus using the whole animal, which viewed from the animal side could be taken as humans asserting complete hegemony over them. All your base are belong to us.

kanji.constituent: voice, samurai, flag, stick
kanji.story: Having lost his voice, the samurai comunicated to his troops with a striped flag.

kanji.constituent: give, mouth, chair, tool, animal legs
kanji.story: Picture of a person facing you. 口 is the head. His right arm is raised (your left), to give you something from a tray 一. His legs ハ are below the tray. 呉れる、くれる, to give: 伯父がこの時計を呉れました, "My uncle gave me this watch." Following -て form of another verb, means "to do the favor of": 窓を開けて呉れませんか, "Won't you open the window [do the favor of opening/kindly open the window]?" Usu. written in hiragana.

kanji.constituent: recreation, woman, give, mouth, chair, tool, animal legs
kanji.story: A woman gives up her recreation time in order to raise a family.

kanji.constituent: mistake, say, words, keitai, mouth, give, mouth, chair, tool, animal legs, mouth2
kanji.story: You must give words of apology when you make a mistake.

kanji.constituent: steam, flowers, helping hand, complete, water, one, floor, oven-fire, barbecue
kanji.story: Think of a picture of someone steaming vegetables. On top you see the flowers of cauliflower or something else that is being steamed. Underneath, the pan is completely full of water. Below the pan is a floor - that's the hotplate - and under that the oven fire. Caution: don't confuse with boil (#1257), or the steam radical in spirit (#1885).

kanji.constituent: acquiesce, water, complete, three
kanji.story: To get someone to completely acquiesce it takes 3 dunks in the water before they give.
kanji.kun_yomi: うけたまわ.る、う.ける、ささ.げる、とど.める、たす.ける、こ.らす、つい.で、すく.う

kanji.constituent: bin, snare, sparkler, shovel
kanji.story: Damn racoons ill show them. I put a snare in the bin as well as a few phosphorous sparklers so as to scare the shit out of the buggers as they rummage through my bin.

kanji.constituent: poles, decay, tree, wood, snare, mouth, crotch, one, floor
kanji.story: Can simplify this using decay (#1243). Then: The expedition to the poles is bad for your health, and the decay that started in your mouth spreads to your crotch – at which point you fall to the floor.
kanji.kun_yomi: きわ.める、きわ.まる、きわ.まり、きわ.み、き.める、-ぎ.め、き.まる

kanji.constituent: tusk
kanji.story: The kanji looks like an elephant with tusks. the box is the elephant´s eye. The final stroke is the tusk.

kanji.constituent: bud, flowers, tusk
kanji.story: Buds while they´re still small tend to be tusk-shaped.

kanji.constituent: wicked, tusk, city walls
kanji.story: The wicked queen builds her city walls out of menacing tusks.

kanji.constituent: gracious, tusk, turkey
kanji.story: Goodness gracious! Such an elegant turkey with a tusk. This mnemonic is meant to join RtK´s keyword with a better proposition. Heisig could have used "elegant" here, which is not confounded so easily with graceful (#721), and accurately represents the character´s meaning (it is also the chosen keyword in Kodansha´s Kanji Learner´s Dictionary).

kanji.constituent: explanation, animal tracks, drop, rice, shaku-hachi, flag, stick
kanji.story: Animal track primitive: As expected, animal tracks were left in place of the trail of rice I´d purposely dropped the night before. EDIT - also try the footprint for a primitive meaning, the classic symbol of detective films. STORY: This shakuhachi player is so talented, he can do interpretations of animal noises too. They´re so realistic he soon has animal tracks leading straight to wherever he´s playing.

kanji.constituent: turn, dice, animal tracks, drop, rice, rice field, brains
kanji.story: The famers take it in turns to watch out for any animal tracks on their rice field.

kanji.constituent: hearing, house, dice, animal tracks, drop, rice, rice field, brains
kanji.story: At your divorce hearing the judge tells you to roll dice to see who keeps the house. ("I can´t believe what I´m hearing!" you say).

kanji.constituent: flip, dice, animal tracks, drop, rice, rice field, brains, feathers, wings
kanji.story: Flipping the bird: After finding out the dice is crooked, you kindly present the middle feather to the dealer.
kanji.kun_yomi: ひるがえ.る、ひるがえ.す

kanji.constituent: clan, flowers, water, water droplets, water pistol, dice, animal tracks, drop, rice, rice field, brains
kanji.story: This character refers to feudal clans that were abolished in 1871 (Meiji 4) in favor of prefectures (廃藩置県), and thus were predecessors of the modern prefectures. As we know from 落, flowers and water drops each have their own way of falling. This character says that clans´ location was decided in the way flowers, water drops and dice fall: at random. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Han_%28country_subdivision%29.

kanji.constituent: fur
kanji.story: I´ve heard of people having hair on the back of their hands, but this is ridiculous! That´s not hair, that´s fur!

kanji.constituent: decrease, christmas tree, fur
kanji.story: The amount of "fur" (needles) on a Christmas tree decreases, until it doesn´t look all that good.

kanji.constituent: tail, flag, fur
kanji.story: A dog waves its furry tail like a flag.

kanji.constituent: home, house, lock of hair
kanji.story: This kanji is, of course, pronounced "taku", and it seems the owner of this home is a little bit otaku himself. He has hung up locks of hair suruptitiously obtained from various females all over his house. A veritable hair fetishist, and certainly someone whose home you wouldn´t want to visit.

kanji.constituent: consign, say, words, keitai, mouth, lock of hair
kanji.story: When you consign a matter to someone, you get their word and a lock of their hair (to be used in a voodoo ritual if they don´t keep their word).
kanji.kun_yomi: かこつ.ける、かこ.つ、かこ.つける

kanji.constituent: do, so, strange building, tail feathers
kanji.story: In this kanji, you can see 3 katakana characters: ソ, ユ, and then ユ again followed by TAIL FEATHERS. STORY: "So (ソ) you (ユ) wanna DO it?" "Only if you (ユ) do" says the female bird as she raises her TAIL FEATHERS.
kanji.kun_yomi: ため、な.る、な.す、す.る、たり、つく.る、なり

kanji.constituent: falsehood, person, do, so, strange building, tail feathers
kanji.story: A person who claims he didn't do something while he actually did, is telling a falsehood.
kanji.kun_yomi: いつわ.る、にせ、いつわ.り

kanji.constituent: long, hair, hairpin, safety-pin
kanji.story: The Geisha with long hair uses an ornate lacquered hairpin to bundle it all up.

kanji.constituent: lengthen, bow, long
kanji.story: The longbow is follows the design of a standard bow, only it has been lengthened.

kanji.constituent: notebook, towel, long
kanji.story: In ancient China books were rolled-up scrolls of paper. So notebooks were nothing more than long towels.

kanji.constituent: dilate, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, long
kanji.story: Taking Viagra let´s your blood vessels dilate...resulting in a body part getting long.
kanji.kun_yomi: は.れる、ふく.らむ、ふく.れる

kanji.constituent: hair of the head, hairstyle, hair, shape, friend
kanji.story: Japanese teenage girls consider the style of the hair of the head very important. If a particular style is trendy, soon they all want their own hair in the same shape as that of their friends.

kanji.constituent: unfold, flag, salad, hairpin, safety-pin
kanji.story: Unfold flag, take out the salad, pin the flag down with hairpins and have a picnic.

kanji.constituent: miss, soil, dirt, ground, mouth, hairpin, safety-pin, mouth2
kanji.story: I miss my parents dearly. Here they lay, under a big cross, their mouths side by side. I stick hairpins in their graves. CAREFUL: the stroke order/primitive order is: ten, L mouth, R mouth, hairpin. "Soil" is not drawn in its stroke order.

kanji.constituent: nest, owl, fruit, rice field, brains, tree, wood
kanji.story: The nest atop of a tree contains the fruit of the owl: its offspring.

kanji.constituent: simple, owl, rice field, brains, ten, needle
kanji.story: Owls are smart...for this owl everything is simple coz his brain is ten times more powerful than mine.

kanji.constituent: war, simple, owl, rice field, brains, ten, needle, fiesta
kanji.story: George W. Bush´s plans for war were so SIMPLE. To him, its all just a big FIESTA.
kanji.kun_yomi: いくさ、たたか.う、おのの.く、そよぐ、わなな.く

kanji.constituent: zen, altar, simple, owl, rice field, brains, ten, needle
kanji.story: Knowing ZEN’s emphasis on “nothingness,” it’s not hard to envision a ZEN ALTAR being quite clean and SIMPLE.

kanji.constituent: bullet, bow, simple, owl, rice field, brains, ten, needle
kanji.story: Hunting with a bow is too complicated. I´m switching to something simpler--using a bullet.
kanji.kun_yomi: ひ.く、-ひ.き、はず.む、たま、はじ.く、はじ.ける、ただ.す、はじ.きゆみ

kanji.constituent: cherry tree, tree, wood, owl, woman
kanji.story: I was taking a picture of my girlfriend under the cherry tree during 花見, when an owl happened to poop on her at the exact moment the shutter snapped. It´s really my favorite picture , just don´t tell her that.

kanji.constituent: animal, owl, rice field, brains, one, mouth, chihuahua, dog, large, drop
kanji.story: The owl looks for its prey in the rice field. It sees so many potential animals to eat but since it only has one mouth, it decides that the tasty looking chihuahua will be its meal for tonight. (adapted from Copycatken,1-9-2006).

kanji.constituent: brain, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, owl, villain, sheaf, shovel
kanji.story: The brain is the part of the body that can give you the wisdom of the owl... or the wickedness of the villain.

kanji.constituent: trouble, Freud, state of mind, owl, villain, sheaf, shovel
kanji.story: When I am in trouble, my state of mind is on two sides: 1. The wise part of me (owl) 2. The villain part of me (villain) Think of the devil and the angel on your shoulders in a troubled situation.
kanji.kun_yomi: なや.む、なや.ます、なや.ましい、なやみ

kanji.constituent: stern, owl, cliff, daring, spike, ear, taskmaster
kanji.story: This represents a stern looking owl, perched up on a cliff. This cliff is quite famous for daring individuals to cliff dive off of, but is any of them daring enough to threaten the owl?
kanji.kun_yomi: おごそ.か、きび.しい、いか.めしい、いつくし

kanji.constituent: chain, metal, gold, small, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight
kanji.story: The chain on this chainsaw is made of little metal shells.

kanji.constituent: raise, owl, tool, hand
kanji.story: The owl was asked to raise his hand if he needed anything, but he had a wing, not a hand! So he made a tool that looked like a hand which he used when he needed to raise his hand. For raiseing, owl has a tool hand.

kanji.constituent: reputation, owl, tool, say, words, keitai, mouth
kanji.story: This owl´s reputation skyrocketed after he created a tool in order to speak human words.

kanji.constituent: game hunting, pack of wild dogs, anemometer, owl, wind, cornstalk
kanji.story: [game-hunting; shooting; game; bag] According to unicode.org and wwwjdic, 鼡 and 鼠 (mouse (#2065)) are variants. So, for 鼡 (which I´ll call rat) I have: an owl, flying in the wind, can easily spot a rat even if it´s hiding in the cornstalks. Now 猟 is easy: wild dogs are having fun by game-hunting rats.

kanji.constituent: bird, white, dove, one, tail feathers
kanji.story: There is only one bird with such beautiful white tail feathers: the albino peakcock.

kanji.constituent: chirp, mouth, bird
kanji.story: A chirp is quite simply the sound that comes from the mouth of birds.

kanji.constituent: crane, turkey house, bird
kanji.story: Do you know how cranes came to be? Well, they used to keep the poor bird cooped all the time. But the crane really wanted to be free, so it would always streatch its head and neck out of the coop trying to be free.

kanji.constituent: crow, drop, mouth, one, tail feathers
kanji.story: The book´s story is just fine, but I found a kanji dictionary explanation also interesting: As crows are all black, it´s hard to see where their eyes are (black on black), so a stroke is removed from the part in the pictograph where the eyes would be.
kanji.kun_yomi: からす、いずくんぞ、なんぞ

kanji.constituent: vine, flowers, bird
kanji.story: In the jungle there is a flowery vine called hedera rhombea that attracts humming birds by the dozens. They scoot around the flowers sucking up nectar off the vine.

kanji.constituent: pigeon, nine, baseball, bird
kanji.story: Feed one pigeon and nine more birds will be swarming you immediately…　RTK2:　On list of rare or no official Chinese reading.

kanji.constituent: chicken, claw, vulture, husband, bird
kanji.story: There are two types of birds often compared to husbands. Yes there are a few vultures out there, but most husbands are CHICKENS. 鶏 【にわとり】 (n) (domestic) chicken, (P) 鶏肉 【けいにく】 (n) chicken meat, (P).

kanji.constituent: island, bird, mountain
kanji.story: This island is the home of the terrible mythical bird Roc. It sits mighty atop the mountain waiting for the next hapless ship to pass by.

kanji.constituent: warmth, sun, day, migrating ducks, claw, vulture, one, friend
kanji.story: Note: Just confirming Heisig has confused these two characters. This is used primarily for weather and climate (and colours).
kanji.kun_yomi: あたた.か、あたた.かい、あたた.まる、あたた.める

kanji.constituent: beautiful woman, woman, migrating ducks, claw, vulture, one, friend
kanji.story: You want to know about a beautiful woman? There´s a woman that´s so beautiful, the birds migrate to her instead of the sun!

kanji.constituent: abet, finger, fingers, migrating ducks, claw, vulture, one, friend
kanji.story: You abet the escape of migrating ducks by pointing them the way.

kanji.constituent: slacken, thread, spiderman, migrating ducks, claw, vulture, one, friend
kanji.story: [slacken; loosen; relax; lessen; be moderate; ease] The thread in this story is a cable line, something like a power or phone line. The thread was tense with all the migrating ducks perched on it, but got back to being slackened when the entire flock flew away. (darg_sama-modified,2-11-2005).
kanji.kun_yomi: ゆる.い、ゆる.やか、ゆる.む、ゆる.める

kanji.constituent: belong, flag, gnats, drop, insect, belt
kanji.story: These bugs BELONG TO an extremist group promoting insect independence. They are parading the FLAG of their group, the Nationalist GNATS, and wearing explosives BELTS for their planned terrorist war.

kanji.constituent: entrust, mouth, belong, flag, gnats, drop, insect, belt
kanji.story: Entrust is to confer trust in someone else. My mouth belongs to you and your secret is safely entrusted with me.

kanji.constituent: accidentally, person, talking cricket, brains, insect, belt
kanji.story: Mr. T accidentially stepped on Jiminy Cricket (a brainy insect, with a belt sort of sash to hold his "conscience" badge).

kanji.constituent: interview, talking cricket, brains, insect, belt, road
kanji.story: On the road to my interview I accidentally bump into Jiminy Cricket who gives me some good advice.

kanji.constituent: foolish, talking cricket, brains, insect, belt, heart
kanji.story: Don´t be foolish! says Jiminy Cricket as he lashes you with his belt. Follow logic, like me, not your heart.

kanji.constituent: corner, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, talking cricket, brains, insect, belt
kanji.story: If you behave badly at THE PINNACLE, JIMINY CRICKET will send you to sit in the corner.

kanji.constituent: inverted, mountain goat, horns, mountain, road
kanji.story: There´s a road that´s been inverted- it´s gone from horizontal to directly vertical! The only beast that could possibly climb it is a mountain goat of course.

kanji.constituent: model, first day of the month, mountain goat, horns, mountain, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, soil, dirt, ground
kanji.story: This guy is such a gifted sculptor. He can model a MOUNTAIN GOAT and a MOON with just SOIL mold.

kanji.constituent: mount, glass canopy, hood, mountain goat, horns, mountain
kanji.story: White mount , Fuji mount , olympus mount whatever ....The choice is yours but wherever you go they sell those snowglobe souvenir : under a GLASS HOOD you can see the mount with a MOUTAIN GOAT standing on top of it .... So kitsch you just can´t forget it .

kanji.constituent: steel, metal, gold, mount
kanji.story: Mount Fuji is completely made up of a metal known as steel.

kanji.constituent: hawser, thread, spiderman, mount
kanji.story: A sturdy thread is equally obviously hawser (heavy rope). (see previous frame).

kanji.constituent: sturdy, mount, sword, sabre, saber
kanji.story: Mount everest is very sturdy, you can hit it all day with a saber and it wont even wobble.

kanji.constituent: tin can, noon, sign of the horse, shovel
kanji.story: Horses kept in the mountains have a unique savory taste. At least so the text on this tin can would have us believe, which contains 100% authentic mountain horse.

kanji.constituent: pottery, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, bound up, tin can, noon, sign of the horse, shovel
kanji.story: Pottery is used for food preservation, the pinnacle of which today is food bound up in tin cans.

kanji.constituent: swing, finger, fingers, condor, claw, vulture, king, mountain
kanji.story: Primitive: A condor is like a vulture but twice the size and lives in mountainous regions (+1 Elphalpo). Story: I swing my fingers back and forth, trying to fend off the attacking condor.
kanji.kun_yomi: ゆ.れる、ゆ.る、ゆ.らぐ、ゆ.るぐ、ゆ.する、ゆ.さぶる、ゆ.すぶる、うご.く

kanji.constituent: noh chanting, say, words, keitai, mouth, condor, claw, vulture, king, mountain
kanji.story: Noh chanting?!? I meant "NO CHANTING!" Now all you, just shut up! Not another word! Don´t you know that chanting can provoke attacks from the local condor? So, no chanting, and especially no Noh chanting.

kanji.constituent: concerning, capital, tall, top hat, mouth, small, little, understandably, chihuahua with one human leg
kanji.story: In the capital they have been having hearings concerning bioethics and bioengineering they call as their first witness a chihuahua with one human leg.

kanji.constituent: sociable, skunk, silver, heart
kanji.story: The skunk here is Pepe LePew of Looney Tunes fame. He´s a very sociable skunk, as far as skunks go, but instead of having a "heart of gold" he has a heart of silver (since he always finishes second in the game of love).

kanji.constituent: groundbreaking, skunk, silver, soil, dirt, ground
kanji.story: It was the groundbreaking of the new farm, but there was an uninvited guest to the ceremony. It was a famous skunk, the one with the familiar silver stripe. The feet of the crowd rushing from the ceremony site churned up the soil very nicely. The ceremony was ruined but the groundbreaking was a great success.

kanji.constituent: excuse, village stocks, rabbit, bound up, human legs
kanji.story: Obviously this is the rabbit from Alice, excusing himself and rushing away on his legs, as he has a binding day schedule. This is at the same time an image, with bound=ears, day=head and legs are just legs. The image is used in rabbit (#2093).
kanji.kun_yomi: まぬか.れる、まぬが.れる

kanji.constituent: deviate, elude, village stocks, rabbit, bound up, human legs, road
kanji.story: Word play to differentiate elude/evade: elude ~= e-lewd. Alice is following Mr. Rabbit on the road. Mr. Rabbit flashes her in a lewd way and disappears, completely eluding her.
kanji.kun_yomi: そ.れる、そ.らす、はぐ.れる

kanji.constituent: nightfall, sun, day, village stocks, rabbit, bound up, human legs
kanji.story: At nightfall the sun excuses itself and goes to sleep.

kanji.constituent: exertion, village stocks, rabbit, bound up, human legs, power, muscle, arnold
kanji.story: When RABBITS hop around, they EXERT tremendous force using their MUSCULAR legs.

kanji.constituent: elephant, colour, color, bound up, sow, pig
kanji.story: An elephant has huge ears, like a rabbit, and a big, fat body, like a sow.

kanji.constituent: statue, person, elephant, colour, color, bound up, sow, pig
kanji.story: Statues of people are made the same size as statues of elephants.

kanji.constituent: horse, team of horses
kanji.story: Turkey with the drops at the top removed and tail feathers added (this matches stroke order and there are the tail feathers already, why not have the whole bird). If you take the two drops of 隹 as wings, then horses are like turkeys, but have no wings and have more prominent tail "feathers". Both are actually supposed to be pictographs, though.

kanji.constituent: pony, team of horses, phrase, bound up, mouth
kanji.story: The new My Little Ponies show is all about magic horses who utter cute catch phrases.

kanji.constituent: verification, team of horses, awl, fit, meeting, umbrella, mouth, person
kanji.story: We just verification that there are indeed no soldiers in the belly of this trojan horse. We´re just gonna stab it in the belly with this awl to check.
kanji.kun_yomi: あかし、しるし、ため.す、ためし

kanji.constituent: equestrian, team of horses, strange, large, St. Bernard, street, nail, spike, mouth
kanji.story: Equestrian events are where you get horses to do strange things.

kanji.constituent: stop-over, parking, team of horses, candlestick, lord, drop, king, jewel, ball
kanji.story: In the olden days you had to park your horse next to a candlestick, a primitive parking meter that you start by lighting a fire and tracks the time by burning down.

kanji.constituent: drive, team of horses, ward, box, sheaf
kanji.story: You have to be craaazzzzyy to drive a buggy led by a team of horses through a ward of Tokyo!

kanji.constituent: station, team of horses, shaku-hachi, flag, stick
kanji.story: Anyone living in Japan knows that train stations play little melodies when the train is about to arrive. In Ye Olden Days, when horses and carriages were used for transport, the carriage driver would play a little melody on his shakuhachi to let the passengers know the carriage was arriving at the next station.

kanji.constituent: boisterous, team of horses, crotch, insect
kanji.story: Or more precisely: the team of horses are getting boisterous because one of them got bitten in the crotch by a horse fly. The kanji also means to roar, make up noise, to kick up a fuss and to make merry. Perhaps it is exactly the etymology behind this kanji.
kanji.kun_yomi: さわ.ぐ、うれい、さわ.がしい

kanji.constituent: burdensome, team of horses, plump, large, St. Bernard, drop
kanji.story: If a passenger is too plump and heavy, its too burdensome for the horse.

kanji.constituent: wonder, awe, flowers, phrase, bound up, mouth, taskmaster, team of horses
kanji.story: You stand in AWE at the 8th WONDER of the world, a huge TROJAN HORSE.

kanji.constituent: fervent, bamboo, team of horses
kanji.story: A fervent horse doesnt need to be whipped with a bamboo stick during a race, it will go fast by itself.

kanji.story: The top 16 strokes are the chinese radical for "dragon". Joining up both meanings of the radical we can name the top part of this kanji "imperial dragon". Two-headed snakes do exist as biological curiosities, and they look a bit like a slingshot (with the heads splitting at a junction). Our imperial dragon here, the pet of a Chinese emperor, is a rare "three-headed slingshot-snake" kept in a vase and fed with meat. When the emperor attacked neighbours, his army wore the imperial dragon garment.
